intro: Meryta colorata, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers and broad, waxy leaves. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and full sun. Meryta colorata is also valued for its use in traditional medicine in some regions.
